Abstrak:
Starting  to  build  his  own  aesthetics  based  on  the  philosophy  of  experience
developed  before,  John  Dewey  made  an  astonishing  announcement—in  light
of  the  tradition  of  aesthetic  studies—that  to  build  a  theory  of  art  one  must
follow  a  roundabout  way  and  that  works  of  art  may  form  obstacles  on  this
way. This is why Dewey’s aesthetics or—as he called it himself—philosophy
of aesthetics is not focused on the fine
 arts, or at least not only on them
Sumber: Value Inquiry Book Series. 2014, Vol. 275, p83-93. 11p
